subject: how to get ant sysproperties
msgSnippet: Hi, I am using ant to run my testcases, target in ant looks like this.
messageBody:
Hi,

I am using ant to run my testcases, target in ant looks like this.



<target name="run-tests" description="Run the model layer Unit tests"
depends="compile,copy" >
<junit printsummary="true" fork="false" haltonfailure="off"
haltonerror="off">
<formatter usefile="true" type="xml"/>
<batchtest fork="false" haltonfailure="off" haltonerror="off"
todir="${tests.reporting.dir}">
<fileset dir="classes">
<exclude name = "**/AllTests.class"/>
<include name = "**/Calculator.class"/>
<exclude name = "**/test.class"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>
<sysproperty key="jbo.debugoutput" value="file"/>
<classpath refid="test.classpath"/>
<classpath refid="Calculator.classpath"/>
<classpath location="${output.dir}"/>
</junit>
</target>

my java program say "Calculator" testcase want to access the sysproperty (eg jbo.debugoutput) of ant. How can this be achieved? Is this sysproperty is for the entire ant session?

thanks
Shubha
